com.math.combinations

Class Permutations

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.math.combinations.Permutations

  • public class Permutations
extends java.lang.Object
    Generates permutations of elements

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Permutations()
      Default constructor takes no parameters.
      Permutations(int n, int k)
      Constructor taking parameters for computing (n P k).

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getK()
      This method returns the total number of permutations that this object acts over.
      int getN()
      This method returns the total number of values that this object acts over.
      long getnPk()
      This method is used to return the value of (n choose k) for the current object.
      boolean hasNext()
      This method indicates if the current permutation has finished generating.
      int[] next()
      This method returns the current permutation and shifts to the next one.
      static long nPk(int n, int k)
      This method computes (n P k) for the given parameters.
      void reset()
      This method resets the permutation to its initial state {0,1,2,.....k-1}.
      void setK(int k)
      This method sets the total number of permutations.
      void setN(int n)
      This method sets the total number of values.
      void update()
      Computes the updated value of (n P k).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Permutations

        public Permutations(int n,
            int k)
        Constructor taking parameters for computing (n P k).

        n_P_k is always ready once the object is created using this constructor however the value if too large will always be erroneus

        Parameters:
        the - total number of values
        the - number of permutaions

      • Permutations

        public Permutations()
        Default constructor takes no parameters. Note that set methods must be used before operating on the methods of this class
        See Also:
        com.math.combinations.Permutations#setN(), com.math.combinations.Permutations#setK()

    • Method Detail

      • nPk

        public static long nPk(int n,
       int k)
        This method computes (n P k) for the given parameters.

        If the value is too large for long a negative number is returned.

        Parameters:
        The - number of values that can be taken
        The - number of permutations required
        Returns:
        the value of (n P k); -1 is returned if the computation is too large to fit in long

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        This method indicates if the current permutation has finished generating.

        A reset is required to start again else subsequent calls will always return the last permutation.

        Returns:
        If the permutation is still not complete

      • next

        public int[] next()
        This method returns the current permutation and shifts to the next one.

        To get the next permutation an inefficient approach is followed. We generate all possibilities like in @see com.math.combinations.SigmaAlgebra and then resolve conflicts if there are two elements with the same value.

        The advantage of this inefficient approach is that it is very simple to implement.

        Returns:
        The current permutation

      • update

        public void update()
        Computes the updated value of (n P k).

        This method should be used if (n P k) is required after calls to @see com.math.combinations.Permutations#setN() or @see com.math.combinations.Permutations#setK()

      • reset

        public void reset()
        This method resets the permutation to its initial state {0,1,2,.....k-1}. After this method the permutation can be generated again by calls to
        See Also:
        next()

      • setN

        public void setN(int n)
        This method sets the total number of values.

        Note: This does not update (n P k). That must be done if required by calling @see com.math.combinations.Permutations#update() Also, to prevent inaccurate states it is advised to call @see com.math.combinations.Permutations#reset() See also @see com.math.combinations.Permutations#getN()

        Parameters:
        The - total number of values

      • setK

        public void setK(int k)
        This method sets the total number of permutations.

        Note: This does not update (n P k). That must be done if required by calling @see com.math.combinations.Permutations#update()

        Caution: An update to k brings the permutations string back to start at 0,0,0....k with all previous progress lost.

        See also @see com.math.combinations.Permutations#getN()

        Parameters:
        The - total number of permutations

      • getnPk

        public long getnPk()
        This method is used to return the value of (n choose k) for the current object.
        Returns:
        the value of (n choose k) for the current object

      • getN

        public int getN()
        This method returns the total number of values that this object acts over. See also @see com.math.combinations.Permutations#setN()
        Returns:
        The value of n

      • getK

        public int getK()
        This method returns the total number of permutations that this object acts over. See also @see com.math.combinations.Permutations#setK()
        Returns:
        The value of k
